ai.summary: An arduous coastal circuit in North Cornwall covering about 19 km along exposed cliff paths and beaches, offering dramatic sea cliffs, sweeping viewpoints, and rugged countryside around Crackington Harbour.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal terrain with cliff-top lanes, stony paths, muddy sections after rain, and a mix of long ascents and descents. Expect uneven ground, exposed cliff edges, occasional rocky steps, and some grassy tracks; conditions can be affected by tides and weather.
ai.safety_notes: Hard 19 km hike with potential long duration; plan for 6–8 hours. Wear sturdy boots and stay alert for uneven ground and cliff edges. Check tide times if route involves beach sections. Cornwall weather is changeable—carry a waterproof layer and wind protection. Carry map and compass or GPS, keep mobile phone charged, and inform someone of your route and ETA. Bring ample water and snacks, a basic first aid kit, and consider a whistle and lightweight emergency gear in case of delay or injury.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket/trousers
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) are ideal due to milder weather and longer daylight; winter hiking is possible but involves stronger winds, rough seas, and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Crackington Cracker Walk: A Hard 19 km Coastal Trek in North Cornwall
seo.meta_description: Tackle a challenging 19 km coastal hike in North Cornwall's Crackington area. Rugged cliffs, dramatic sea views, and remote paths. Gear tips, safety notes, and season guidance.
seo.h1: Crackington Cracker Walk – North Cornwall Coastal Challenge
